qas.question: Which has a longer playing time: PAL LaserDiscs or NTSC discs?
How many audio tracks do PAL LaserDiscs have?
Which two audio options are available on PAL LaserDiscs?

answers.text: two analog-only tracks on older PAL LDs, or two digital-only tracks on newer discs

context: <a0_0>PAL LaserDiscs<a0_0/> have a slightly longer playing time than NTSC discs, but have fewer audio options. PAL discs only have <a1_0>two<a1_0/> audio tracks, consisting of either <a2_0>two analog-only tracks on older PAL LDs, or two digital-only tracks on newer discs<a2_0/>. In comparison, later NTSC LDs are capable of carrying four tracks (two analog and two digital). On certain releases, one of the analog tracks is used to carry a modulated AC-3 signal for 5.1 channel audio (for decoding and playback by newer LD players with an "AC-3 RF" output). However, older NTSC LDs made before 1984 (such as the original DiscoVision discs) only have two analog audio tracks.
